Reviews.Title: “clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: bigv19
Reviews.Content: It was about 5 minutes by car from Napa Downtown and we had a microwave & a mini-fridge inside the room. Very clean. Good simple breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, clean room”
Reviews.Author: DandKtravel
Reviews.Content: This was the most reasonable price we could find as we were not going to be spending a lot of time in the hotel. We were only spending one night coming from Calistoga to do a napa valley bike tour the next day. The room was large and clean,with a mini fridge. There is a grocery store across the street if you want to pick up dinner. There is breakfast provided in the morning with cereal, coffee / bread/ bagels / juice.

Reviews.Title: “affordable & clean”
Reviews.Author: Mike_1234z
Reviews.Content: While by no means cheap, this is an affordable hotel for those wanting to stay in the Napa area. The room was spacious and clean, the AC worked well, the front desk staff friendly. The hotel quickly reachable from Hwy 29. A drawback is downtown Napa is not easy walking distance, perhaps a mile or so away. There is a small strip mall shopping center in walking distance, but I hope you eat better than that in Napa! The breakfast was only cold food such as cereal and fruit. Still for what other places charge this is an attractive value, and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: MsMarijane
Reviews.Content: This is a two star motel in the heart of wine country in California. It is clean, quiet, and comfortable. The neighborhood immediately surrounding the hotel is half industrial, but the motel is yards off highway 121. The main highway to the Silverado Trail, Lake Berryessa, etc. etc. So if you are using your motel to sleep in and go see the countryside, this place is great. It is moderately pricey for what it is, but location, location, location. Very stiff bed. There is an outdoor pool and a coffee-mat breakfast room. But there are sooo many good restaurants nearby we didn't worry about motel food.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Rose C
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here over the weekend and were pretty satisfied. Lodging was affordable and conveniently located near the Wine Train station. A basic, clean, and functional place, especially for the weekend. The only downside was the "complimentary breakfast" indicated as part of their amenities. It wasn't what we expected. All they provided was cold cereal, fruits, juice/milk in refrigerator. No one was there when we stopped by one morning. That definitely should've been emphasized in their description! We expected a little more with that! Luckily, there was a McDonald's, Jack in the Box, and Denny's close by. Otherwise, this place is one of the least expensive options in the Napa area...

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, clean & friendly inn”
Reviews.Author: WhereIntheWorldisJen
Reviews.Content: I only stayed a night here and enjoyed it. This was one of the least expensive options in Napa and I was on a budget. I hoped for a neat and clean room, that's exactly what I got! The front desk staff was incredibly nice and helpful, they went above and beyond in helping print a trip voucher and in helping get a coat I left on a tour bus back to me. The breakfast isn't much to speak of, but they do provide coffee and fresh fruit (among more sugary breakfast items that I try to stay away from) which I appreciated. The room isn't fancy, but it's neat and clean. The bathroom was sparkling. They do provide soap, shampoo and lotion which were of decent quality. The toilet is way to close to the vanity, someone didn't measure well when they renovated! But, it works. There is a tv in the room with limited channels, but hey, you're in wine country! You're not supposed to be watching tv! I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Wine Lodge”
Reviews.Author: tradlyn
Reviews.Content: Very good, friendly staff, good and clean room in a good location. There is nothing else to say except I will stay again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “I was here for the wine and the wine only.”
Reviews.Author: semanticvision
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, basic updated motel. Clean and functional. You really would not care after a day of wine tasting.

Reviews.Title: “Bits of charm, affordable price, good location”
Reviews.Author: Waflsey
Reviews.Content: Got in at midnight because we refused to pay over $100. for a room just for a one night stay. This place was recommended when we pressed the attendant at a chain hotel for something affordable. Charming courtyard with citrus trees and beautiful roses everywhere - something most affordable places don't worry about. The room was clean and bed was comfortable, tv, microwave, nice shower, continental breakfast was pretty standard but well maintained even toward the end of the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Liberal use of bleach”
Reviews.Author: deruo
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night as planned, at this place. Yes, it's cheap but it's also kind of sad in a way. It's a property with so much potential if they put some effort and some $$ into it. It looks like Stalag 13 as you're driving by on the highway. We arrived to front desk staff person that really didn't seem to want to be at work that day. She gave us a room on the left side of the property, even though we were one of few people staying there. We arrived to an overpowering smell of bleach in the room upon arrival. The door was open, perhaps to air it out and you could smell the bleach before you even got in the room. I can see why they used so much bleach. There was mold in the shower. It took forever to get hot water in the bathroom sink. The windows in the bathroom were filthy and the screen even worse. (See photo) Despite the dirt/mold in the bathroom, the rest of the room was clean, so I rated it average. One thing I've learned from my travels and especially my line of work is that photos often make a property look much better than it appears in "real life". Some of the photos you see here on Trip Advisor give the impression that it's a very nice place, where the reality is that i wasn't sure whether our room had been refurbished or not. I don't think so. Pros: microwave and fridge in the room, less expensive than other places in the area, basic continental breakfast in the am, pool (we didn't use as it was too cool - December visit) Cons: tired facility, like walking back into the 1950/60's with shower stalls and bathrooms that are really run down and showing their age, dirty screens, apathetic staff (on our visit), hair dryer not working Would I stay here again? It depends on the price, and I certainly would ask for one of their newest rooms - if they have them.

Reviews.Title: “A good clean value in Napa Valley.”
Reviews.Author: JedNevada
Reviews.Content: The Valley Lodge is a very good value in Napa. It's location is great, right off the highway. The grounds & rooms were very clean and basic. All you really need, a comfortable bed & a hot shower. The staff was very friendly. When we checked in we were given suggestions on restaurants and lots of discount coupons. The property has a pool and is just far enough from the highway that it's quiet. With all the expensive choices in Napa lodging this property is a great value. If you're looking for clean & basic this is a great choice. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Patti Z
Reviews.Content: The lodge is an average place to stay. The price was right and we just needed a place to sleep for an early departure the next morning. The room was nice with a microwave, mini-frig and coffee maker. The one thing missing was a hair dryer which did create a problem for me. When we were there a lot of construction workers were staying also. The breakfast was basic with just cold cereal, danish, and toast. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable stay”
Reviews.Author: clou89
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights 10/25 - 10/27. It was a great choice. We were looking for something affordable, comfortable, and close to town. It was all of these plus. Normally we like to stay in places with some amenities and the usual bells and whistles but this time we decided the extra money would be better directed toward the purchase of wine. We were a little worried about what we were going to get for the price but were not disappointed. This is a fairly basic place but it was clean and updated, with great space. The room had a fridge, with complimentary water, and a microwave. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was good sized, clean, and had good water pressure. The toiletries were basic but usable. All around a great value. The exterior was well kept, had plenty of parking, and had nice areas to sit and enjoy the great weather. The breakfast was limited, but we had read about this in previous reviews and expected that. We went in one morning to grab some cereal and coffee to get us through until our breakfast in town. Again, nothing special, just realize what you are getting and plan accordingly. Overall this was a great place. It perfectly met our goal of saving on accommodations but still having a nice place to rest up for the next day's tastings. I would definitely recommend and will book again when we return to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Visit.”
Reviews.Author: gipsylily
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night at the Lodge. The room was clean and pretty sound proof. There was crown molding that really added a nice touch. Water was complimentary and so was the basic continental breakfast. We only grabbed fruit and coffee on the way out. My only complaint was the very hard bed. Both my daughter and I woke up feeling quite sore.I don't know if all the beds are the same..... From the description of the location, we expected to be able to walk to town for the evening, but it actually was quite a distance and we decided not to. If it was Summertime, with longer days, we might have decided to walk through the neighborhoods to get to town. Overall, a nice stay and the fact that it was built in the early 50's added some ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: aussiesmithfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night while having a look around Napa. The room was clean and tidy with free wi-fi,fridge,coffe maker,tv. Breakfast was included, cereals,toast,fruit,coffe,tea and juice.Comfortable bed and clean bathroom, with quick check in and good recomendations from the Lady behind the counter with wine tastings and vouchers.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to rest after drinking wine all day”
Reviews.Author: zelestina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this inn for 3 nights. The location is great if you wish to spend drinking time in Sonoma and Napa Valley. Easy to reach, big parking, huge bad right away when you enter the room (if you drink as much as us, you'll appreciate it:-)). There is a pool, but it was cold, so we didn't use it. Free WiFi in the room, comfortable bed. You can smoke on porch. The stuff was very helpful. They gave us tips for sightseeing and coupons for dinning. But their breakfast is awful. It round the experience. Good news - there is a refrigerator in the room, so you can keep there you own food.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay within easy reach of Napa centre”
Reviews.Author: stevej2209
Reviews.Content: This place was simple, clean, quiet and inexpensive. I had a very enjoyable stay here taking the 15 minute walk down the road to the town centre. Not too much to do there but some nice places to eat in the evening. The pool was clean but the furniture surrounding it could do with updating. Word of warning, do a little research if you plan to take a wine tour and don't book through the hotel. I paid $99 for a wine tour and that didn't cover the wine tastings.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: trustypoo
Reviews.Content: You just never know exactly what you're getting when you book on line but we were not disappointed. Our room was nice and clean. The landscaping was gorgeous. The pool was nice but it was a little too cool to enjoy. If we ever go back to Napa we would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, clean lodge”
Reviews.Author: Jenny T
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the lodge only at the evening for a one-night stopover stay. The room was clean though a little tiny and tired-looking. Parking is convenient as it is just outside the room, but that also means you can smell the exhaust from inside the room. Wireless connection inside the room was spotty. The heater/air-conditioner unit was a tad noisy; not sure if it is a maintenance problem. The breakfast mainly comprised cereals and pre-packed snacks for on-the-go. Given its location, the lodge is considered value-for-money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Nugent44
Reviews.Content: Our stay was much nicer than I expected. We were only visiting Napa for one night and just needed a cheap place to catch some zzzzz's. We were a bit unsure as we pulled up, but as soon as we checked in and drove back into the property, our minds were put at ease. Our room was very recently redone ... it actually smelled a bit like paint in there, but not too bad. It had some nice touches with the crown molding and unique fixtures in the bathroom. The only complaint, which would be very easy to fix, is the continental breakfast. Cereal and bananas with some pre-packaged sweet rolls was a bit disappointing, considering how we had been pleased with the room quality. Just plan a breakfast stop before stopping at your first tasting. I would stay here again since this is a very minor gripe.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DRB59
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a great value and is more than meets the eye. I did not expect much, but the rooms were newly remodeled, clean and very comfortable. And the price is very reasonable, especially for Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan0204
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. We stayed here for two nights while attending a wedding at the peak of high season in Napa Valley. This hotel was by far the cheapest hotel in Napa Valley proper that we could find, so we were not expecting much. But our room (#44) was very clean, recently remodeled, with good water pressure and a very comfortable bed with pillowtop. It is also conveniently located to downtown Napa and the rest of the Valley. The wi-fi is free and the breakfast is serviceable. For the amount we paid, it was a terrific value and we will definitely stay here again the next time we are in the Napa area.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Valley feel without being stuffy”
Reviews.Author: Sulfurcreek
Reviews.Content: The terra cotta roofs, the cozy and comfortable rooms and a more than adequate breakfast made for a great preview for a wonderful Napa Valley Wine Train experience. This 1953 property is very well kept and tastefully restored..

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place - retro feel reminds of family roadtrips from long ago”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on first night of a vacation trip to Napa wine country in July 2011 due to a dearth of hotels available that week. ...and what a pleasant old school surprise it turned out to be! We got the last available room at this motel, and can say it was a very nice experience. This quiet property is located in the heart of Napa in a somewhat residential area not far from the old Napa downtown. It is a very clean and updated motel that had to have been built in the 1950s or 1960s heyday of automobile vacations. Rooms were WiFi enabled, large, and very clean. Each has updated decor with cable, mini fridge, nice comfortable beds. The air conditioning silently, efficiently cooled the place. The front office staff could not have been nicer or more helpful! And there was a great (if slightly smallish) swimming pool in the center of the property, ringed by the rooms and parking lot. Adjacent to the pool was a picnic area with manicured lawn and bushes, replete with a concrete table and benches. Travelers here during my stay included some German family tourists, a few young families, as well as some honeymooners. A couple of older couples rounded out the visitors I observed during the stay. Breakfast was the only thing that was slightly disappointing about my stay. Free, but not quite continental was how it could best be described. The Wine Valley Lodge is a nice little slice of retro Americana and proved to be a great place to spend a night or so. I would definitely consider stopping in again during the next vacation trip to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelbug0717
Reviews.Content: I read the good reviews on the Wine Valley Lodge and was disappointed with the motel. The room smelled like cleaning fluid. The bathroom was in need of remodeling. The sink was cracked, the grout around the shower was black/rusty- dirty looking. For $147.00 per night I didn't expect luxury, but thought it would be clean. However, the staff were nice & helpful with suggestions/directions etc.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value”
Reviews.Author: Azapple
Reviews.Content: Older property that is clean. Great Napa location for the price. Breakfast is packaged Danish and cereal. Coffee is surprisingly good. Bed was hard as a rock. Hotwire rated it two stars and for a two star property it is great!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Hereandthere12
Reviews.Content: Nice pool, clean rooms. The pool needs to be heated. Walking distance to restaurants. One mine from Downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: KikouOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: This Napa motel was a nice surprise. The reception was very helpful, providing maps, local dinner recommendations, coupons and useful items such as razors and toothbrushes. The pool was very nice, and the landscaping was pretty. The room was large and clean with powerful air conditioning and a modern shower. A cold breakfast was included in a sunny room provided with newspapers and the morning news on TV. Wireless internet is provided in the rooms. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay. It was good value for $74. (We following the restaurant advice given and our meal was a highlight on our trip.)

Reviews.Title: “Surprinsingly Good”
Reviews.Author: bogdansan
Reviews.Content: Booking it very late, one of the few locations available at a decent price for weekend stay in Napa. If you want to experience a classical US motel it is the best way to do it. Very cautious at first, after seeing the cleaninest of the room you start to feel good safe it.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, good location”
Reviews.Author: blinkoshuman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Comfy and clean room. Bathroom was a bit sketchy, but clean. No problems with showers or appliances. Breakfast was basic, but good. Front desk clerk, Judy was very helpful with giving us recommendations for wineries or restaurants. She really gave us good advice. Location is great. Very close to town and highway. Walls between rooms are paper thin. We could hear everything going on in the rooms next door...and I mean EVERYTHING.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a two star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chredi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at the Wine Valley Lodge. You do have to conseider that this is a pretty cheap two star hotel, but we can say that our room was clean and nice, if you can live with the green wall papers. The bathroom was also clean and nice, the room had a refrigerator and a microwave. A light complementary breakfast is included in the price which was all right. Nothing fancy! The front desk was very helpfull and gave us some great advise on vineyards as well as coupons. We can really recommend this place if you wish a good low budget alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy, moldy, moldy bathroom”
Reviews.Author: MommyH63
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights. It wasn't so good. The handles on our Bathroom sink had mold growing on them. The shower door and handles also had mold. The window in the bathroom did too. I told the manager about it the first day, she was nice and said she would have it cleaned. When we came back it was still there. Our bed was very uncomfortable. I wouldn't recommend it, especially if you're allergic to mold.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: rhea_ameet
Reviews.Content: We didn't spend too much time at the motel, but we were pleasantly surprised how comfortable and spacious our room was. The room was clean and since we were on a road trip and had food with us, we were very happy that the room was equipped with a bar fridge and microwave. The front desk was friendly and helpful. They gave us food recommendations and provided us with coupons to the restaurants we were going to. The continental breakfast was lame - the food was highly processed. But they did have hot water/coffee and fresh fruit which we took advantage of. The location of the motel is perfect. It's right next the highway (easily accessible to the wineries), and is about a 5 min drive into town. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: KARAKAKIWI
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and felt like others - it's not flash but is comfortable, clean and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraGV
Reviews.Content: not the most romantic place to stay, but totally worth it. Close enough to downtown Napa. Room was clean. Staff wasn't the nicest, but wasn't rude either. Breakfast was ok. And it was cheaper than anywhere else we looked.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DaisyJane_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Wine Valley Lodge - on February 19, 2011. I booked my room online and made a mistake - booked it for March 19th. When I arrived, my mistake was discovered but fortunately they still have 2 rooms left for the night, and the clerk quickly made the change and gave me the same type room I had reserved on-line - one King sized bed. All rooms are non-smoking, which is great. The room is on the small side, but very clean, nicely painted, and very comfortable. There were several complimentary items in the reception area: a small Suave hand lotion, a disposable razor, small tube of toothpaste, etc. There was also a free bottled water in the small fridge in the room. The king bed had a firm mattress (which I like), the heater warmed up the room relatively quickly. Yes, the heater was a bit on the noisy side - sounds like a fan rattling around or something - but it didn't really bother me because I turned it off after I went to bed. All the staff were friendly and helpful. I was able to park right in front of my room. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet at night. I will definitely stay at this motel again the next time I have an overnight stay in Napa. It's not fancy, but it's probably one of the best lodging values in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Standard motel: OK, but some room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: JR-from-London
Reviews.Content: A standard motel, with rooms grouped round a central yard. The rooms could benefit from some refurbishment and the thin walls mean that it could be difficult to have a peaceful night when the place is busy. We stayed on a chilly night and some extra blankets would have been useful, as the alternative was a very noisy heater. The breakfast is good, with fresh fruit, but the rather hectoring notices make you feel like a naughty schoolboy. The pool was closed when we visited, although we would not have been able to use it. The place is fairly conveniently located, near an out of town shopping centre and about a mile from the "quaint" downtown. Overall, worth a try but maybe not on a busy weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: flexabull
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room in Napa. Small, but with a nice large comfy bed. Location is close to everything, but far from scenic. Slept well, friendly staff, free breakfast, and fair priced. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Napa”
Reviews.Author: tholmes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on a trip around California. Hands down this is the best value in the area, and that's why we picked it. It was a decent but basic base for exploring the wineries and the town of Napa. My husband had never stayed at an American motor inn, so he was actually kind of charmed. There were nice citrus trees in the courtyard, and the room was more than adequate. The check-in lady was a bit rough around the edges. She wasn't happy we had booked our winery tours in advance and stressed that she could've gotten us better deals, then showed us her brochure that would've saved us a grand total of five dollars and not included many amenities we received. We didn't really like being hassled to switch plans on check-in. Breakfast was terrible, and no one ever cleaned the breakfast room, resulting in spilled cereal, milk, and bread crumbs all over every table. It was pretty gross, but we grabbed bananas and explored the beautiful outdoors. Some say the location isn't walking distance to downtown, but we're New Yorkers, so we disagree. A 20-30 minute leisurely stroll with not a single hill just isn't too bad. If you drove, it'd take all of two minutes. All in all, the room was clean, the location was convenient, and the value was unbeatable. We'd stay here again if we were looking to save.

Reviews.Title: “Nice inn in the heart of wine country”
Reviews.Author: KSchm26136
Reviews.Content: Management was pleasant and accomodating. Rooms were clean, and the bed was fine. Nothing fancy, but very adequate. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Motel with good bed”
Reviews.Author: latiffe
Reviews.Content: Good king size bed. Easy parking. Not a good area to walk around. Located on outskirts of Napa. There is absolutely nothing special about Napa. Just a few shopping blocks with B minus restaurants. Awfull "breakfast". Just a few bags of dry cereal with hot water. They should not advertise this as a breakfast. Skip it. Good value around $75-90. Agree with other reviewers: good sleep, short drive to wineries. And if you dont have money you can always say "we better spend money for wine..."

Reviews.Title: “Need to have accurate expectations when you stay here”
Reviews.Author: VWebb
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly reasonable motel lodge. The room was sufficiently clean and the location is very good. It is an old place though. The furnishings are nothing special, the bathrooms are small, the whole place is slightly worn. HOWEVER, the price is great and if you don't need the "Napa B & B" experience you'll be just fine and you'll save some serious money! They do provide a light breakfast for free - more money for wine tastings!

Reviews.Title: “Great little budget place....spent the saved money on lovely wine!”
Reviews.Author: siobhanonthehill
Reviews.Content: We wanted seomwhere simple clean, but not paying 400USD per night at one of Napa Valley's incredibly expensive hotels. This place is simple, clean and pretty good value. I booked online for us, but I think you can get better walk in rates as other guests were paying less than us. I would definitely recommend this place for a short driving stay in Napa, especially if you are a wine-loving couple like us who arent multi millionaires! Only slightly negative point is that the breakfast isnt great, but it is included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but ok for "taking a Napa"”
Reviews.Author: KMKTraveller
Reviews.Content: It's a refurbished motel on the outskirts of Napa proper, but it's cheap, clean and friendly and we enjoyed our night there. Not a bad choice if you want a spend a night in the wonderful wine district without paying a fortune. Car is needed also in the evening because unfortunately it's not really walking distance into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad option if you just need a place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: sophlin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights during a very busy weekend. We booked somewhat last minute for a wedding in the area, and there were just not even that many options - even ridiculously expensive ones. We decided in the end that we weren't really going to spend a ton of time in the room, so it didn't make a lot of sense to shell out lots of money for really just a place to sleep. The rooms were fine. It could be a little noisy as people came back somewhat drunk from dinner or events and then some others would get up fairly early. In the end though, we were happy just to have found something somewhat close and fairly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for the right price in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Traveler34680
Reviews.Content: This is not a quaint B&B or luxury hotel. It is simply a clean and comfortable motel. Beds are comfortable, place is clean, staff was pleasant. Nothing special but more importantly, nothing gross, dirty or made me uncomfortable. It is within 10 miles of many wineries and restaurants. I was looking for something reasonably priced and comfortable. This place met my needs. I’d stay here again if I passed through this way again. If my wife was with me then I’d look for something with a little more charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Napa”
Reviews.Author: 2sant
Reviews.Content: Basic accomodations and a great value in Napa. Located just north of Carneros and 10 minutes south of the wine frenzy on Rt. 29, we choose this place every time we go wine-hopping. The beds could be more comfortable (they're pretty hard and thin), but for a clean, convenient place to shower and crash between days in wine country, it fills the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good value..no frills..money saved spent on wine :)”
Reviews.Author: mrfuni
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about 5 years ago and unfortunately the room we had is showing it's age. Low water pressure a bummer. Still a good value for the area. Refrig and micro in the room, sparce contl breakfast. Front desk women are the nicest you'll ever meet. Great for directions, winery coupons, and wonderful conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tiggerew
Reviews.Content: The room was exactly as described, nothing fancy but had everything you need, bed, shower, bath and TV. The wireless internet was free and provided good connectivity. The breakfast was nothing fancy but a lot better than many offered in this price range. Overall would definately stay here again if I was visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: kitkatkrish
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to stay in Napa, but didn't want to pay the high prices that normally come with it, so we decided to go with this place because of the positive reviews. Overall, I'd say it was a good value, and the breakfast they served was yummy! (Don't drink the mochas from the machine though!! Beware! haha) It was clean, comfy, and in a prime location. My only complaint is that the room wreaked of cleaning solution when we checked in, but I guess that is better than the alternative! I'd definitely stay again if I visit on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Good price for Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: TravelSchafer5
Reviews.Content: We got what we paid for with this one. Small room and small bath with tiny stall shower. The free internet was very slow and we only had 8 channels on the TV. The front desk lady was awesome, she knew all local places to eat and things to do, they even give out coupons for free appetizers and wine tasting. The breakfast is pretty terrible, packaged pastry things, toast and cereal. Check out is at 11 AM and at around 9:30 we were getting dresses and packed and a cleaning lady (without knocking) swiped her key card and walked right in our room!!! We told front desk but they said it wouldn't happen again (I don't think we will be in Napa Valley again any time soon).

Reviews.Title: “very nice place and great service”
Reviews.Author: jeff7031
Reviews.Content: this motel was decently priced and in a good location.continental breakfast was adequate...the people working here were very friendly and helpful.all in all we had a very nice 4 nite stay and would do it again.....

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in the area for Great Price, great service !”
Reviews.Content: This is one of the least expensive hotels in Napa that has continental breakfast, free parking and wireless internet. The hotel room was clean, comfortable, with great cleaning staff. This is our second stay and it was a memorable one too. As usual swimming pool is in great shape, with very good breakfast. Walking distance to downtown. (1 mile). One need to think twice before paying fancy price for other pricy motels.

Reviews.Title: “If you're tall or don't like pain, try someplace else”
Reviews.Author: Steversjunk
Reviews.Content: Although they provide a clean room with a decent bed, plus a small breakfast, beware, if you're tall (5'11" or taller), and good luck washing your hair in the short, tiny showers. In addition, you'd better hope that no one in another room flushes their toilet when you're in the shower. Both my wife and I paid the price when someone else flushed! Also, the walking distance to downtown is better served by driving your car so you have the energy left to enjoy downtown! By the way, the staff indicated that the owner's wouldn't give a discount for any 'pain or inconvenience' we may have suffered. Try for something more modern if you really want to enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but check for fleas”
Reviews.Author: 2adultkidsand2teens
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Wine Valley Lodge was very nice in almost every way. We were in the Elvis Suite which is where Elvis stayed when he was filming "Wild in the Country." The only problem was that they had fleas. We came home with many bites. The management assured us they have a spray supplied by a veterinarian that they will use to get rid of the fleas. I would recommend that anyone who is planning to say there go into the room and check it before committing. You would only need to stand or walk on the carpet for a few minutes to see the pesky critters on your feet or ankles if they are still there. Breakfast was adequate, cleaning staff was pleasant and helpful, pool was pleasant, but for $225 per night, I wish I didn't itch.

Reviews.Title: “Your average hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: coconutfan2010
Reviews.Content: This is one of the least expensive hotels in Napa that has continental breakfast, free parking and wireless internet. The hotel room was clean. The sound insulation is poor as you can hear next door's television. This hotel does not have a fan in the washroom so the mirror remains fogged for a while after a shower. There was also no hair dryer. The room did come with a microwave and a fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Simple, No Frills”
Reviews.Author: Keenasira
Reviews.Content: Stayed at WVL because of other recommendations on TA. It's as the title of this review says....clean, simple, and no frills. The queen size bed seemed new and was quite comfortable... the room's are adequate, and we've travelled all over the world, so rarely stay 5-star as our trips are usually outdoors orientated or ones that staying in the hotel room for more than just sleeping really isn't on our itinerary. If you're traveling to Napa for food and wine, and like us, only use the room to sleep, then I recommend this. The only disappointments were that the internet was pretty spotty (yeah, yeah...I know, I'm on vacation and what the hell am I doing checking work email and sending files, right?), the complimentary continental breaktast and coffee was better left alone (go to Whole Foods in Napa and buy your breakfast and store it in your room frig.), and there was some mold on the shower grout and around an aging shower door. The WVL is getting dated, but if you're like us, not horribly picky about every little hygenic thing, then this place we'll suit you just fine.... besides the money we saved was spent on some great tastings and meals at places like Bouchon... which is, afterall, why we came to Napa in the first place....

Reviews.Title: “great value and clean funky/cool place”
Reviews.Author: WeavervilleQuince
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times and always have a great experience. Large, clean rooms with microwave and fridge. Be sure to check out the hotel history. It is very interesting. I think the Lodge should advertise that more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: oeflyingkiwi
Reviews.Content: Well most people coming to Napa would have a car however we did not so it was a little inconvenient but we were only there for a few days. No laundry facilities. Good in room heater. The breakfast was excellent, 3 fruits, 3 cerials, toast, porridge, danish, juices, and a coffee machine. In a brekfast room which was nice. Beds were comfortable. Walls were a little thin - could hear the neighbour snoring. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for our Purposes”
Reviews.Author: RogueBee
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay in three years. What we like is that we can make a reservation for just Saturday night (even during Harvest) rather than the two night minimums most other places want for weekend stays. A simple continental breakfast is provided, although the waffle machine I remembered from last year is no longer offered. The price is reasonable. (It is Napa.) Our rooms have been clean. We've received what we have paid for. There is a nice pool in the center of the courtyard parking lot. Front office staff is minimal. They will print out online seating passes for us without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “clean & inexpensive for Napa”
Reviews.Author: love2travel060
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days (2 weekdays & 1 Friday). We were greeted by the office staff and had a great visit for the three days. We used the pool and it was clean and refreshing. We noticed that the furniture was new, bedspread was new and clean. Overall very satisified with the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Clean, Quaint & Close - Save $ for Food & Wine”
Reviews.Author: TempeTravelBug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wine Valley Lodge on a last minute trip to Napa for wine tasting. It was clean, quaint and close to everything we needed. You'll still have to rent a car, but there is a starbucks and convenience store in walking distance. There are no frills, but we were happy to use the money we saved on great food and wine.

Reviews.Title: “We chose this hotel after reading the Trip Advisor reviews”
Reviews.Author: miraban
Reviews.Content: This motel is much less expensive than the other hotels in the area. We did not expect to find a room equal to a $200 a night hotel so were not disappointed. The location is fine if you have a car. We liked the easy layout of the rooms and parking. The staff invited us to help ourselves to coffee in the breakfast room even though it was closed. After reading the reviews I was not sure what to believe but booked it because the price was reasonable. The room was airy, clean and had all of the amenities we enjoy. We did not feel like we had compromised our standards to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, and a good value”
Reviews.Author: improvman
Reviews.Content: First, we saved quite of bit of money by calling the motel to make our reservation. Their web site, the America's Best Value web site, and Expedia all had different prices, and all had different cancellation policies. The motel is basic. The neighborhood isn't great, but it's a $5+ cab ride to downtown Napa. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom is what it is. Functional, with a tiny shower (it's low, so I wouldn't advise it for anyone over 6'3"). The sink had cracks, but was otherwise fine. The other drawbacks were the thin walls, the lack of a jacuzzi. Also, their website mentions belgian waffles with the continental breakfast, which they are no longer allowed to serve. So please remove it from your website. Otherwise, the continental breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: tj100
Reviews.Content: I wish I had my camera with me. I checked in late, was tired and it was dark so didn't notice how dirty the room was until the next day. Something crusty dried on the carpet, shower completely gross and disgusting with mold everywhere. Other people's hair in the shower, on the sink, on the bed. I have travelled extensively and often stay in "budget" hotels. I have never encountered a room so dirty. Not even close.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere but here!”
Reviews.Author: nsharma45
Reviews.Content: I'm not normally negative about my vacation experiences because it's VACATION, so I try to make the best of it, but this place really got to me. I had made my reservation through their website on Monday, for a check-in date of Thursday for a two night stay. My friend needed only a one night stay and checked in on Friday. My rate was $89 for Thursday and $149 on Friday. My friend's rate was $89 for Friday night. I paid $60 more for a disgusting room! When I discussed it with the Manager she stated there was nothing she could do about it. I explained that I was being punished for booking in advance from their site. She said I wasn't being punished and said it was just like booking through a discount website. I said I didn't see the similarities between booking through the discount sites and the hotel site. She said that was the “Napa way”. If that is truly the Napa way, I’ll just have to frequent another region of California that has a large wine crop. Then she mentioned if I had called in my reservation she might have been able to help. I inquired how that would be different with the intention of providing that information here, so no one else would have to be punished for using their website and booking in advance. She said well I don't know. Then she asked why I hadn't brought it to their attention the night before and I stated I did not know he had gotten a better rate. I would have thought with so many vacancies they would have extended the special rate to customers who booked directly through them – whether online, over the phone or in person. And I hadn't even thought to ask my friend what he had paid. She still would not adjust my account. In this economy they made the choice to turn away any future business by not adjusting the rates they assigned to me. The room was disgusting. The floor has some thing on it next to the bed. It was crusty and when I walked over it with clean feet that I had recently put lotion on, it turned my foot the color of the carpet. The shower had a lot of black mold in the grout and the drain. The drain was almost completely covered in hair as well. The bathroom window was broken. It opened to the apartment complex next door, with hardly a fence. The bathroom didn't have a fan either, which made showering extra fun! The best part was, when I checked out I discussed it with the Manager. She stated that the room was clean. When I took her to the room I stayed in to show her what I considered dirty she stated she still believed it was clean. Looked at the black mold and said the shower was fine. Felt the carpet with her foot and said there was nothing on the carpet. How's that for customer service, but it gets better.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Little Place”
Reviews.Author: midwesttraveler10
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel in the residential area of Napa. It is well priced and clean, but it is a bit older with exterior entrances. We spend most of our time out at the great wineries and restaurant, and the hotel was just a place to stay. The breakfast is minimal but continental. The customer service is really lacking. During none of our times to the front desk for items, did the desk clerk even get out of her chair or greet us with smile. Other than the customer service, it was what I would expect for the price.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: humanone
Reviews.Content: Although there is nothing romantic or luxurious about this place, there is absolutely nothing wrong with it. I am here now, using their free wi=fi after having a great night on their pillow top bed. The room is plain but spotless, with new paint and new carpet. The waffles are gone, because of some licensing rule in Napa, and with the protein we brought from home (cheese for one day, hard boiled egg for another) it was a good free breakfast with fruit, juice, toast, cereal, and a coffee machine that makes latte, espresso, cocoa as well as decaf and regular coffee. As for noise, now that the bridge is complete there is none. The motel is on a quiet residential street. At under $100 a night it is a real find in Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Wine Valley Lodge and Great Waffles!”
Reviews.Author: travel4day
Reviews.Content: After much searching for economical rooms in the Napa Valley, I decided to reserve three rooms for a group of us at the Wine Valley Lodge. The rooms were clean and staff was quick to attend to our needs. The Lodge isn't great but it served our needs. The waffles, fruit, oatmeal, cereal, milk, juice and coffee made for a good breakfast. Napa Valley has changed very much in recent times. Everything is expensive. Wine tastes now have a charge of $15 -$25 in most wineries. On are walk home from the Italian restaurant, Felipe's -sobriety checks were going on in town by the local Napa PD. Otherwise, Wine Valley Lodge is were I would stay if I visit Napa again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Decent Room”
Reviews.Author: melglaz
Reviews.Content: Two of my girlfriends and I went to Napa for the 2008 Labor Day holiday weekend and we reserved the Elvis Suite at the Lodge. When you drive up, it becomes apparent that "Lodge" is another word for Motel. The two room suite was large and the beds were new and pretty comfortable. There were two minor drawbacks - the bathroom needs to be updated and the AC in the 2 bed room either was the artic tundra or not on and hot. The staff were perfectly friendly and helpful, but obviously they don't offer the same level of service as a higher priced hotel with a concierge. This was a perfect place for us, we planned everything out before we got to Napa since we wanted to eat at some specific places (def try Julia's Kitchen - Wed night is a fixed prix locals dinner, and if in Sonoma The Girl and the Fig is good too) and didn't need hand holding. Plus two of us had been to Napa before and had an idea of how to get around. If you need someone to help map out your stay, this is not the place for you! This is for the self sufficient who just need some directions on how to get somewhere. I'd definitely stay here again, its right off of Hwy 29 and is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: kristad314
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here last year and remember the room being clean and very large, so we gave it another go. We stayed for 2 nights. Upon checking in we got to our room and it was A LOT smaller than we had remembered. So much so that I think there are different size King rooms. The place is a very no-frills type of place, but very convenient to Napa Wineries and downtown Napa . The bathrooms could use a little updating, but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. Free Wi-Fi is available in your room, which was great. The room included a desk, dresser, TV microwave and fridge. There is a free continental breakfast, which we had passed on this time around, it’s nothing exciting and the coffee wasn’t the best. Across West Imola Avenue is a shopping Center with a Rite-Aid, diner and some other stores. All-in-all, if you are looking for a cheap, nothing fancy, clean place to rest your head while exploring Napa Wine Country then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: champagnegirl62
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Wine Valley Lodge, choosing it for the price originally. However, I would gladly book rooms there again, and would recommend it to others who are looking for comfort and value in (what can be ) expensive California wine country. We found the rooms to be large, well equipped, comfortable and quiet. We are pretty independent travellers, so we were not looking for a lot of advice, but the staff was pleasant and accommodating when we needed some assistance (we were both sick for a couple of days). Breakfast was mainly a self-serve affiar, but was adequate for our needs. The location was excellent for access to wineries, downtown restaurants, and other shopping conveniences. The day we were leaving, the vintage sign was being changed, indicating a new affiliation with a nation-wide organization. We sincerely hope that this will not lead to any signficant changes in the place!

Reviews.Title: “OK-what to expect for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Johan_Whistler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is NOTHING fancy! You are very close to downtown Napa and it was clean-other than that expect nothing. The staff was friendly enough-but not helpful at all if looking for recommendations. The rooms were clean-except our shower didn't drain at all and accumulated about 3 inches of water while showering. The surrounding area or "views" from your windows are pretty bad and looks dirty. Regardless-it was really convenient, cheap, and in a safe enough area! It is not in walking distance to downtown unless you have a 1/2 hour to kill and don't mind walking 3 or so miles!

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Reesee
Reviews.Content: I could say you get with you pay for with this one, but that wouldn't be fare. I have stayed in some pretty cheap places to save a buck, and have been able to sleep through the night. This is Napa, consider the idea that you may have just had the worst night sleep of your life, and now you are supposed to go out and drink wine all day long. The idea of doing this today, makes me nautious at this very moment. The hotel is along a highway so you hear cars passing by all night. The walls are paper thin, so when the neighbors came home at 2 am, of course we heard it all. The window in the bathroom doesn't lock which had me up waiting for an intruder. And the bed is soo hard and uncomforable that I would wake up ever two hours to 'flip' b.c my entire body would be numb. When people say that this bed is uncomfortable and is like sleeping on concrete, they are not kidding. I now am left with the most horrible night sleep of my life, a headache and I have no urge to 'enjoy' Napa whatso ever. I think if I even smell wine today I will get sick. Please Please Please don't be so cheap as to stay here, you will not be able to enjoy the rest of your trip. Spend $20 more dollars and get a decent night sleep so you can enjoy your vacation. This stay has taught me that being this cheap will never pay to do again. This has ruined my vacation completely. If I wanted to be exhausted when I come back to work on Monday I could just have stayed home done the laundry and cleaned my house.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a trip to wine country”
Reviews.Author: tucsonlawstudent
Reviews.Content: We went to Napa Valley last May and stayed at the Wine Valley Lodge based on reviews on this site. It was near the major thoroughfare, clean, and cheap - everything we wanted and nothing we didn't. We wanted to spend our money on good food and wine, and the Wine Valley Lodge was a great value. We're planning a return trip this May and already have a room booked.

Reviews.Title: “For $50/night, you cannot go wrong here!”
Reviews.Author: E-TripCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Picture a 1950's single-story next-to-the-highway drive-up-to-your-front-door motel, and that's the Wine Valley Lodge. The room was small, and the bed wasn't super-soft, but the amenities were modern and it looked like the place has been renovated since the 1950's (and since the 1970's, even). Sure, there was a little mold in the shower cracks and a stray hair here and there, but overall, it was clean... and only $50 a night. Free breakfast including do-it-yourself-waffles in a small room nearby. There's a courtyard in the middle with a pool; looks like a good post-wine-tasting hangout for the summertime.

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect”
Reviews.Author: MostinLegend
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, cheap, easily accesable and perfectly good place to stay for the price. By saying that I do not wish to retract from the place itself, I have stayed in far better but have had to pay a lot more to do so, its clean, comfortable the staff where friendly and the breakfast was straight forward but fine and adequate, by the time we had sampled several bottles of what napa is famous for we slept fine, the bed was comfy, the area quiet, plenty of parking. I liked it! In short a bargain and if your on a budget you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you have a flexible spine or like sleeping on the floor”
Reviews.Author: #1 Bay Area Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on November 3rd, which was plenty. Check in was easy, and the front desk person was very friendly and even offered dining recommendations. The room itself was very clean, TV worked just fine (even had HBO!), and the bathroom was small, but also just fine. For the price ($80 for one night with a king bed), this was a bargain. Our only issue was the bed was unbelievably hard. Not firm, I mean rock hard. Laying in it, I could trace the individual metal coils in the mattress with my fingers, and the bed just did not give at all. It was like sleeping on a concrete floor. In the morning, we both had red marks on our skin from where we contacted the mattress. Maybe if we brought a foam bed pad it would have been a bit more bearable. I'm sure this would be great for those who are very young and have flexible spines. I'm "only" 40 and in good health, but maybe I'm just too old to sleep on something as hard as the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Wine Valley Lodge”
Reviews.Author: animlluvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wine Valley Lodge for 3 nights beginning our all girls birthday vacation. We got in around 1 a.m. and there was someone ready and waiting for our arrival. The lodge was easy to find and in a quiet area. It is very quaint and 5 minutes from downtown if driving. There were 3 of us in one room and there was plenty of space. The beds were extremely comfortable!! The room was very simple but just perfect for what we were looking for. The price was just right and they have a great little breakfast building with make- it- yourself waffles, danishes, fruit, cereal, toast, oj and a fantastic coffee machine that makes great mochas. The staff was accommodating and friendly. If you're looking for a place that is quaint, comfortable and affordable this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: sscolieri
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. Large rooms with king bed. 15 min walk to downtoen Napa and close to many winers. The Motel was very clean and well maintained with a large pool. For $89 a night we thought it was a bargin. Front desk was also very helpfull from the moment we arrived. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, very clean, surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: TXbrandi
Reviews.Content: I am pretty picky about hotels but I have to work on a budget so I am often disappointed with the hotels in my price range. This hotel was actually really nice! Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. The grounds were well kept. Very positive experience and at $89/room, it was a great way to save some money and still get a good night of sleep. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A True Bargin in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Robious
Reviews.Content: Initially checked into another hotel in Napa for a weekend stay, but was horrified by the room (a complete dump). We had been to the Wine Valley Lodge before, and it has good comfortable beds, clean rooms, and a truly decent price - for a price significantly lower than the dump we went to first - the Wine Valley Lodge is a steal. The rooms are not real big, but do have nice touches (crown molding, small refrigerator with free bottles of water, free high-speed Internet). Granted the hotel is on the edge of town, but one can be on 29 or get to downtown Napa in less than 5 minutes. Coming back from a trip to the wineries the Wine Valley Lodge is an easy commute. For about 90 bucks a night it runs well over a hundred dollars (or much more) less than hotels in the area. That said, the pool is okay, and they do give you a continental breakfast (although I would suggest making the short drive over to Sweetie Pies in the Napa River Inn - the best bakery in the Valley - which offers an amazing breakfast). There is no bar, there are not pretty grounds to look at, and there is no real view to speak of. It's just a great place to crash while in the valley.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay for Napa”
Reviews.Author: niku9122
Reviews.Content: Wine Valley Lodge is a good bargain for the Napa area. I gave the lodge an above average ratiing since the price is reasonable :) Checking in and out is easy -- Room is relatively big-- nice king size bed and comes with cable TV, Fridge, Microwave, hairdryer, iron and iron board :) Also comes with complimentary continential breakfast -- which includes cereals, toast, waffles( self made with premix waffles batter), coffee,juices and fresh fruits. Location is quiet with easy access to highway 29 and the Wine Train.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: 2ez4me
Reviews.Content: A good value in Napa at $89 per night (weeknight). The room looked recently renovated with a large king bed, fridge, microwave, and pretty clean bathroom. Breakfast was decent, with waffle makers, cereal, fruit and pastries. The area seemed relatively quiet and we didn't hear anything through the walls which was nice. The only noise came from early risers packing their cars and slamming doors in the morning. Conveniently located just south of the Napa wineries and about 20-30 minutes from the Sonoma wineries. The gentleman at the front desk is friendly...the woman (his wife?)...not so much. She came into our room at 11am (checkout is 12) and asked if we were ready to leave yet so minus 1 gold star for that. Otherwise the motel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back.”
Reviews.Author: Sunnys_Day
Reviews.Content: My first disappointment was finding the property on the very edge of town as far away from the 'wine country' as it could get. It was also not in the nicest neighborhood. We were put in a room away from the street as requested, but apparently this hotel is popular with construction crews in town working and we had three rooms full men drinking beer and standing outside their rooms smoking and talking very LOUDLY till after midnight. We called the front desk several times and they were unable to do anything about it. The following day the staff moved us to another room while we were out wine tasting and we returned to find ourselves in a room at the front of the hotel on a busy street listening to traffic all night. The rooms themselves were clean if a bit spartan, they had fresh paint, it took forever for cold water and the bathroom light seemed to be hit or miss if it would turn on. We had one white hand towel and three dingy grayish bath towels. The hot waffles and espresso machine at breakfast was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very surprising”
Reviews.Author: 15may06
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant surprise. On approach to the lodge in the dark, it looked like it was in a rough and busy area with the flyover close by but it was actually quite tranquil and the traffic noise could not be heard. Front desk was friendly. The rooms were a good size, very clean and good value however the towels were quite old and tired. The bathroom was cold however it was spotless. There was free internet and complimentary breakfast was served in the breakfast room where you could actually sit and eat there instead of taking it back to your room. Its location was close to downtown Napa by car. It was easy to get to the wineries and the Silverado Trail.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: she31462
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were on a road trip through Northern California and decided to stop off in wine country for a few days. We consulted our oh so handy AAA book and decided on The Wine Valley Lodge after doing a drive by. We got a kick out of it's motel style layout! We found the man at the front desk completely charming and our room was more than adequate. It was very clean and safe, and it showed absolutely no wear and tear. The fridge was very convenient as it allowed us to store a few provisions for our two night stay. We're both smokers and all of their rooms are non-smoking. No biggie - all we had to do was open the door and step outside. All rooms have a chair outside, which was a nice, comfortable touch. The Wine Valley Lodge's location was a good jump off point for us since it's convenient to the highway. We had a swell time visiting several wineries and will definitely stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: jagdish
Reviews.Content: I am totally new to US and arrived from Irland. I was surprised through the way motel facility had treated us. Very good location in Napa Wine valley where you can go the best restaurants, bike ride & wine train station. This is a very clean and nice property of one story bldg. Outdoor pool is real fun with picnic area where you can meditate and barbacue both. Quite location with even local trasportation and buses. Well managed continental break fast every thing is brand named. Mattresses are new along with carpet in all rooms. Winery are very nearby. I feel like safe place to pass my relax time to this motel

Reviews.Title: “Decent no frills accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ashcalif
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed there the memorial day weekend on the Sat. and Sun nights. We booked with less than a week's notice so there wasn't a lot of choice in the area. This place was about $120/night which wasn't bad given the short term booking and based on the prices of other places that still had availability. The only staff we dealt with was when we checked in at the front desk, and he was pleasant. The room was basic - it had a tv, clock radio, and desk in addition to the bed - sufficient for us since we were only sleeping there. The continental breakfast is limited as mentioned, but it's convenient if you want to get something small and quick before heading out. Parking was ample - we had no problem parking in front of our room. The rooms aren't very sound proof, but as long as your neighbors aren't too noisy then that shouldn't be a problem either. All in all, a reasonable place to stay if you're not looking for anything special.

Reviews.Title: “The flooding wasn't their fault...however”
Reviews.Author: bond0607
Reviews.Content: The Wine Valley Lodge was a bit pricey for the money due to the fact that it is in a flood zone and we were right in the middle of the December 31st floods. The staff was nice enough to call us and offer help to evacuate, but I now know why the parking lot was so desolate for it being a holiday week. The room had not been used in a while--the first odor we smelled when entering was mildew (after the flooding I know why, the water came in from the bathroom and carpeted closet) The bathroom faucet ran brown rusty water for several minutes and we chose to buy some bottled water. Room was clean and very quiet, except for some drunk teens who just wanted to park, then puke in the parking lot the night before the flooding began. Very interesting experience. Probably won't get any kind of a refund, since we were checking out on flood day anyway, but if the owner or manager reads this and wants to practice good customer service, a credit would be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable & clean”
Reviews.Author: NW_Family_of_5
Reviews.Content: Typical small town motel, somewhat dated but clean. Bed was okay not great. Breakfast was cereal, toast, and bad coffee. Price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Clean”
Reviews.Author: zinful
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Friday night when there was a local winery doing a complimentary tasting with snacks - a special suprise! The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful with dining recommendations. The room was a motel style room - nothing too exciting. We were told that the rooms had been rennovated about 15 years ago and they were starting to do another round of rennovations. It's about a 20 minute walk through a residental neighborhood to downtown where there are lots of shops & restaurants. The continental breakfast was sparse (cereal, juice, coffee) with things not labeled. A great price for a room where the next best price was at least $75 more a night. I'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: slowolf
Reviews.Content: This 1950-60 era motel is a great value for the area. It is a horseshoe shape centered around a swimming pool. No frills here but the rooms are clean and quiet and the bed is comfortable. A step above Motel 6. The staff was quick and efficient at check-in and check-out. There is a continental breakfast included with the room price and it is standard cheap motel fare, which included generic coffee, cereal and a toaster to make toast. Enough to hold us over until finding a breakfast house. We would definately stay here again if trying to stick to a budget as we were this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Tax Charge???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Still in process of determining extra $13.86 charge we were billed for staying at WVL. Supposedly, according to WVL, this fee is taxes that were not included in our initial online fee. Have purchased many, many rooms online and have never had extra tax fee applied. Wonder if they are omitting the taxes to make it appear the room is a better deal???? Still researching. WVL is in older section of Napa, next to some sort of river construction area, not at all scenic. Breakfast barely exists. WVL needs a major facelift in order to just stay afloat in Napa. Napa Valley is a gorgeous, gorgeous region. Would recommend visiting the region, but pay the extra and stay somewhere other than WLV.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: vetism
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Napa after staying two nights at Wine Valley Lodge. This is a nice, clean motel located just minutes from Downtown Napa. The rates are very reasonable for the area, although if your main objective for visiting Napa Valley is wine tasting, you'll find Wine Valley Lodge a bit far from where most wineries are located (15-30 min. drive). The room is comfortable and clean. The bathroom is clean, but lacks a bathtub (shower only). The water pressure is low, and the water temperature fluctuates quite a bit. It is evident this motel was built in the 50's, and hasn't been renovated for a while. The building, furniture, and decor of the rooms are all very dated. You won't find internet hookup here, and if you need a hair dryer or iron, be prepared to make a trip to the front desk, as they're not available in the guest rooms. All in all, we would stay here again, but only if we couldn't find another property at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the area”
Reviews.Author: seasue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and it was just what we expected. The location is close to the freeway without any noise. The room was a good size and clean. The breakfast was filling and the staff friendly. We sat by the pool one afternoon to nap after yet another day of wine tasting. It is a short drive to downtown Napa restaurants, and a bit far from the wineries, but that's ok for the money we'll continue to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for, and sometimes less”
Reviews.Author: CatPanamaCityFL
Reviews.Content: The staff is polite and helpful but the room we stayed in definitely had probelms. A broken latch on the shower door, and a toilet that ran all night, and the refridgerator door fell off when we opened it. The heater didn't work, and over all the room could use some updating including a coat of paint. However our room was large, clean and had comfortable beds. Out of 3 hotels we stayed in that week, it was the highest price and the lowest quality.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Old-school charm combined with super friendly service. Our hosts for our long weekend were helpful, the continental breakfast simple but satisfying and our room clean and tidy. Check out the artist consignment shop next door for some beautiful and unique souvenirs. We prefer to spend our dollars on the wine when we're in Napa; the affordable rates at Wine Valley Lodge afforded us a few extra tastings!

HotelInfo.Name: Wine Valley Lodge
HotelInfo.Address: 200 S Coombs, Napa, CA 94559
